long: Meaning: to "pull off", i.e. (by implication) to "expose" (as by stripping); specifically, to "betroth" (as if a surrender); figuratively, to "carp at", i.e. "defame"; to "spend the winter".  Usage: betroth, blaspheme, defy, jeopard, rail, reproach, upbraid.  Source: a primitive root; also denominative (from "H2779")
